name: git
body:
# A Very Basic Introduction

These pages are an introductory explanation to `git` aimed to newcomers.

My background is not technical. My education is in the humanities. I am only an average computer user.

I have been using `git` for some years. I donâ€™t use it for programming code, but for texts. And I find this tool extremely useful.

The book aims to explain why `git` may help you to manage text files in a better way.

## Download

The book is available for download for free. Please, respect the [licensing-terms].

Since the book is its very early stages of composition, only a minimal document is available:

* [PDF version](https://archive.org/download/git-intro/git-intro.pdf).

The document only includes cover, title, dedication and epigraph pages. The work is in progress.

## Licensing Terms

_`git`: A Very Basic Introduction_ is available for free download at <http://www.git-intro.tk>. The work is not available under a free license.

The book is released to the public with the standard copyright protection. Only download for individual or private use is allowed.

If you want to share the work, please share the domain address <http://www.git-intro.tk>. The new reader will get the latest version available, and not an obsolete one.

## Comments

If you have anything to comment on this project, please [open an issue](https://github.com/ousia/git-intro/issues/new).

Remember that all comments are public. Prior _GitHub_ registration is required.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
